article:
The ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010 Conceptual Model of Architecture Description [http://www.iso-
architecture.org/42010/cm/ A Conceptual Model of Architecture Description], on
ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010 Website defines the term architecture framework as:

"An architecture framework establishes a common practice for creating,
interpreting, analyzing and using architecture descriptions within a particular
domain of application or stakeholder community. Examples of Architecture
Frameworks: [[MODAF]], [[TOGAF]], Kruchten's [[4+1 View Model]], [[RM-ODP]]."

Especially the domain within a company or other organisation is covered by
enterprise architecture frameworks.

The Survey of Architecture Frameworks [http://www.iso-architecture.org/42010/afs/frameworks-
table.html Survey of Architecture Frameworks] of the ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010
Website lists some of the available architecture frameworks.
